text: I feel like I trust too fast, giving my trust to people before I really know them.
I feel like I trust too slow, taking a very long time to trust people even when they've proven themselves.
I feel like I never trust people, no matter how much they've proven themselves to me.
I can trust people at an appropriate pace, neither too fast nor too slow.
I have difficulty trusting people because of past betrayals or hurts.
I feel like I give my trust too easily, even to people who haven't earned it.
I can build trust gradually and appropriately in relationships.
I feel like I never fully trust anyone, even people I've known for a long time.
I can trust people who have proven themselves trustworthy over time.
I feel like my trust issues prevent me from forming close, meaningful relationships.
I can balance being cautious with being open to trusting others.
I feel like I trust too fast, too slow, or never, and I can't find a healthy middle ground.
I can trust people appropriately based on their actions and behavior, not just their words.
I have difficulty trusting people because I'm afraid of being hurt or betrayed again.
I can maintain healthy trust in relationships without being overly trusting or completely closed off.
I feel like I trust too fast, too slow, or never, and this causes problems in my relationships.
I can recognize when someone is trustworthy and build trust at an appropriate pace.
I feel like my trust issues make it impossible for me to fully trust anyone.
I can work through my trust issues and learn to trust appropriately in relationships.
I can trust people at a healthy pace, neither too fast, too slow, nor never.
